semantic_title: Completed Weeks of Gestation Calculation and Assignment
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Chapter 15: Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > a. General Rules for Obstetric Cases > 7) Completed weeks of gestation

content.full_text: In ICD-10-CM, 'completed' weeks of gestation refers to full weeks. For example, if the provider documents gestation at 39 weeks and 6 days, the code for 39 weeks of gestation should be assigned, as the patient has not yet reached 40 completed weeks. (Evidence: pg no: 64, L43-L45)
content.summary: Guidelines for calculating and assigning completed weeks of gestation codes (Evidence: pg no: 64, L43-L45)
key_concepts: Completed weeks definition (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44)
Full weeks requirement (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44)
Gestational age calculation (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Completed weeks refers to full weeks only (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44)
detailed_rules.explanation: Partial weeks do not count toward completed weeks calculation (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Round down to completed weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)
detailed_rules.explanation: 39 weeks and 6 days codes as 39 weeks, not 40 weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify documented gestational age in weeks and days
Step 2: Count only completed full weeks
Step 3: Assign code based on completed weeks, ignoring partial weeks

code_ranges.description: Weeks of gestation codes (Evidence: pg no: 64, L43)
usage_rules: Round down to completed weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

specific_codes.description: 39 weeks gestation of pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)
specific_codes.context: Used for 39 weeks and any number of days up to 39 weeks 6 days

code_patterns.description: Weeks of gestation pattern (Evidence: pg no: 64, L43)

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient at 39 weeks and 6 days gestation presents for delivery
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient presents in labor at 39 weeks 6 days gestation by LMP
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify gestational age as 39 weeks and 6 days
Step 2: Determine completed weeks = 39 (not yet 40 completed weeks)
Step 3: Assign Z3A.39 for 39 weeks gestation

correct_coding.rationale: 39 completed weeks, partial week does not count toward next completed week (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Patient has not completed 40 weeks yet
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Rounding up partial weeks to next completed week

breakdown.Z3A: Weeks of gestation category (Evidence: pg no: 64, L43)

examples.rationale: Patient has not yet reached 40 completed weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)

warnings: Do not round up partial weeks to next completed week (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)
best_practices: Always count only completed full weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44)
Verify gestational age calculation with provider documentation
common_mistakes: Rounding 39 weeks 6 days to 40 weeks (Evidence: pg no: 64, L44-L45)
Including partial weeks in completed weeks count
tips: Remember that 'completed' means full weeks only
Check ultrasound dating for most accurate gestational age
implementation_notes: Requires careful attention to documented gestational age
